participant_1.name: Oliver
participant_1.personality: Enthusiastic and creative, always looking for new ways to innovate in his field.
participant_1.background: I am the leader of the french fry research department at del taco. My favorite band is up. My lifes passion is designer french fries. I once fell up a whole flight of stairs. My daily driver is a bicycle that you pedal with your hands.

participant_2.name: Emily
participant_2.personality: Adventurous and playful, she enjoys exploring new experiences and is not afraid to try unconventional things.
participant_2.background: I am one of four children. I have never traveled out of the country. I enjoy going on hikes. I work some very odd jobs.

content.text: Hi, what do you do for a living?
I work some very odd jobs.
Oh, like what?
I've been a waiter, a bartender, a construction worker, and a personal trainer.
Wow, that's a lot of different jobs! What's your favorite job?
I'm not sure I have a favorite job. I like them all for different reasons.
What's the strangest job you've ever had?
I once worked as a personal trainer for a group of celebrity cats.
That sounds amazing! What was it like?
It was a lot of fun! I got to work with some really cool cats.
What was your favorite part of the job?
I loved getting to know the cats and helping them to get in shape.
That's so cool! I've never met a celebrity cat before.
They're just like regular cats, except they're famous.
What's the biggest difference between working with celebrity cats and working with regular cats?
The biggest difference is that celebrity cats have more money and they're more demanding.
I can imagine! What's the weirdest thing a celebrity cat has ever done?
One time, a cat peed on my shoe.
Oh no! That must have been a bad day.
It wasn't the best day, but it was a funny story.
I'm sure it was! I'm glad you got to have a good experience with celebrity cats.
Me too! It was a lot of fun.
